title: Jessye Norman was the spikiest and haughtiest of divas – but opera has lost a majestic talent
text:
Hers was a voice in the grand style – warm and deep in timbre, majestic in phrasing and imperious in delivery – and her regal physical presence and personality were of a piece with it. You did not mess with Jessye Norman; she had a high sense of her calling that gave her justifiable pride in her achievement, but this sense of self-esteem made her no easier to deal with. Although she eschewed the indignity of tantrums and walkouts, she treated conductors, colleagues, fans and minions with a gracious hauteur that could, on occasion, become downright patronising.

On the grounds of her African-American identity and her ample figure, she was extremely sensitive. She did, undoubtedly, encounter a degree...
